CENTRE NUMBER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 250, 715, 284]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[725, 243, 907, 286]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 306, 220, 321]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 598, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 608, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 756, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 744, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln (3x + 1) - \ln (x + 2) = 1\), giving your answer in terms of e.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 443, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that the variable \(x\) is such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 100, 675, 120]]<|/det|>
\[1.3^{2x}< 80\qquad \text{and}\qquad |3x - 1| > |3x - 10|.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 920, 161]]<|/det|>
Find the set of possible values of \(x\), giving your answer in the form \(a < x < b\) where the constants \(a\) and \(b\) are correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 141, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 100, 611, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} + b x^{2} + 37 x + 10\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 920, 161]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is also given that the remainder is 40 when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((2x - 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 174, 156, 191]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 173, 373, 191]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 174, 920, 191]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 631, 92]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 100, 616, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = 2\mathrm{e}^{2t} + 4\mathrm{e}^{t},\qquad y = 5t\mathrm{e}^{2t}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 140, 156, 159]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 138, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) in terms of \(t\) and hence find the coordinates of the stationary point, giving each coordinate correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the normal to the curve at the point where the curve crosses the \(x\)-axis. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 84, 710, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 292, 356, 311]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 312, 603, 333]]<|/det|>
\[y = x^{2} + 3x + 1 + 5\cos {\frac{1}{2}}x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 337, 920, 373]]<|/det|>
The curve crosses the \(y\)-axis at the point \(P\) and the gradient of the curve at \(P\) is \(m\). The point \(Q\) on the curve has \(x\)-coordinate \(q\) and the gradient of the curve at \(Q\) is \(-m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 384, 156, 402]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 384, 667, 403]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(m\) and hence show that \(q\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 410, 564, 431]]<|/det|>
\[x = a\sin {\frac{1}{2}}x + b,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 438, 660, 457]]<|/det|>
where the values of the constants \(a\) and \(b\) are to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 439, 920, 457]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 495, 92]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that \(- 4.5 < q < - 4.0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 411, 193, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 411, 920, 447]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part **(i)** to find the value of \(q\) correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 428, 920, 447]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
